result.execSummary:
The defendant Micheal L Marschner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

Counseling deemed necessary, which may include anger management counseling.

Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

No contact with victim, A.C., unless approved by agent.

Submit to DNA sample.

records.addlTxt:
11:10 Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant wishes to withdraw his plea on count 3 and will plead to count 2. Court will proceed to sentencing today. Victim makes statement. Attorney Grode makes statement and recommends 18 months of ITC and 18 months ES.
P.T. makes statement on behalf of defendant. 
Attorney Slattery makes statement and recommends county jail and probation.
Defendant makes statement.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 8:34 Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Defendant Micheal L Marschner in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. Bond is continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.

2:44 Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court with attorney Travis Stephen Slattery.  Defendant Micheal L Marschner in custody.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Slattery indicates that he does not feel there is probable cause in the complaint. Attorney Constable states that she can show probable cause during hearing today.
Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today. 
Aaron Wargowsky is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Constable. He is a police officer with the City of Marshfield. On 6/27/14, he responded to a disturbance at a residence in the City of Marshfield. A neighbor told him that he heard kids crying and yelling for help and indicated which apartment it was coming from. He saw the defendant looking out the window. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. They knocked on the door and no one answered, but he could see defendant looking out the window. The used forced entry into residence. Defendant and victim were covered in blood. A 10-year-old child explained what happened during the incident. She told of defendant hitting victim. Child tried to call 911, but defendant took phone away from her. She indicated that defendant was choking her mother and she was not able to breathe. He observed contusions on the victim. Attorney Slattery cross examines witness.
Court does not find probable cause in counts 1 & 3 of criminal complaint.
Attorney Constable makes statement.
Attorney Slattery makes statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued. 
Attorney Slattery requests that no contact provision of bond be removed. Victim makes statement. State objects. Court denies motion to modify bond. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell alcohol.  
No contact with A.C., M.K.C., and/or M.R.B.
No contact w/AC, MKC, or MRB.    Absolute sobriety, do not enter any establishments that sell alcohol. Do not possess weapons.
Defendant Micheal L Marschner in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter to be set for preliminary hearing.
